column4: guys i feel a bit silly but i can't locate the flash plugin file itself, on 10.04 with the adobe ppa.
npviewer
doesn't exist on system or in repos?
coorect, it's not open source - it's a proprietary driver/download
and the service is called "npviewer"
$ pgrep npviewer
doesn't show anything.  and does this mean there's no .so or anything to point hulu desktop to?
just means there's no flash running, that process only runs when there's flash video running
i see.  could i perhaps install the old flash plugins, have hulu desktop use those, but specify the newer stuff for my browsers etc
not sure what you need an old flash plugin for?
kuz when i try to run hulu's desktop app it complains no flash plugin found and i don't know where to point .huluwhatever at with the flash setup you're describing
hmm, didn't know hulu desktop existed... let me check
fantastic.  yeah it's beta but my roomie dies when it doesn't work and i'm trying to get her to stick with linux
ah, a prostelatizer... what's the advantage of the desktop app as opposed to the website? Is it faster?
yes it does stream faster/lighter, allows you to customize your video settings a little easier, lighter on cpu also, plus queues the whole show instead of just 5 minutes or so, when you pause it
nice, dling now to see if I can recreate the issue (I'm on lucid)
excellent.
i found a thread somewhere about someone using 32bit flash for hulu desktop and 64bit for everything else
hmm, worked out of the box for me :s
gl!
appreciate the help.  i'll install it fresh since flash is working now and see what happens
how can i get my hands on the old .so 32bit plugin itself?  i'm trawling the repos and the installers don't have the file itself at hand
